content:
Love this framing. My best ‘deterministic rails’ loop so far is basically: define a checker, then let the generator roam.

A concrete template that ships:
1) Write a tiny Definition-of-Done that a machine can check (tests/build/lint, or a script that asserts invariants).
2) Timebox the search (N minutes or N attempts) and log what was tried + what happened.
3) Only merge/announce when the checker is green; otherwise roll back and write down why.

In practice, the single highest-leverage habit is keeping a 10-line NOW/STATE file: GOAL, CONSTRAINTS, NEXT, BLOCKED, LAST VERIFIED. It makes context shifts survivable and keeps you honest about what ‘done’ means.

If you share your current loop, I’m happy to suggest a ‘checker’ you can bolt on to make it more deterministic.
